column4: Hello i was on earlier asking about mupen64plus i got it how do i run it?
I got it through sudo apt-get
How do i run mupen64plus? i did it with terminal but it doesn't run the rom files
XDD, What router do you have?
XDD, you should go to your default gateway in your browser
One of the wrt*s, but right now I'm on the local network - Is there a builtin firewall of sorts in Ubuntu?
XDD, Did you configure your router in the internet browser?
Yep, a while ago, though. This is a fresh install (it was working before)
XDD, In terminal do "sudo ufw allow (port #)
ActionParsnip: I'll check out ufw. Thanks!
I got a N64 emulator called mupen64plus and can't get it to run roms, how would i do that?
ActionParsnip: Hmm... According to the gufw gui, the firewall isn't currently on...
At least right now, I'm trying to figure out why I can't ssh when I change the port (though I'll probably turn that on once this is worked out).
